summary.para: Specifies and retrieves metadata information from parameters and columns of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

Docs.param: To be added.

remarks.para: Only the following are allowed to be passed to the constructor as : Bit, BigInt, DateTime, Decimal, Float, Int, Money, Numeric, SmallDateTime, SmallInt, SmallMoney, TimeStamp, TinyInt, UniqueIdentifier, Xml.
The following are the default values assigned to , depending on the SqlDbType (the , , , and properties are set to null):

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name and type.

Docs.param: The name of the column.

MemberSignature.Value: public SqlMetaData (string name, System.Data.SqlDbType sqlDbType, long maxLength);

Docs.param: To be added.

remarks.para: Only the following are allowed to be passed to the constructor as : Binary, Char, Image, NChar, Ntext, NVarChar, Text, VarBinary, VarChar.
Only a specification of , or -1 is allowed for a of Text, NText, or Image.
For a of Varchar, Nvarchar, or VarBinary, a length specification of , or -1, declares the metadata as varchar(max), nvarchar(max), or nvarbinary(max), respectively.
The following are the default values assigned to , depending on the SqlDbType (the , , , and properties are set to null):

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name, type, and maximum length.

Docs.param: The name of the column.
The maximum length of the specified type.

MemberSignature.Value: public SqlMetaData (string name, System.Data.SqlDbType sqlDbType, Type userDefinedType);

Docs.param: To be added.

remarks.para: Only the following SqlDbType is allowed to be passed to the constructor as : UDT.
The following are the default values assigned to , depending on the SqlDbType (the , , , and properties are set to null):

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name, type, and user-defined type (UDT).

Docs.param: The name of the column.
A instance that points to the UDT.

MemberSignature.Value: public SqlMetaData (string name, System.Data.SqlDbType sqlDbType, byte precision, byte scale);

Docs.param: To be added.

remarks.para: Only the following SqlDbType is allowed to be passed to the constructor as : Decimal.
The following are the default values assigned to , depending on the SqlDbType (the , , , and properties are set to null):

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name, type, precision, and scale.

Docs.param: The name of the parameter or column.
The precision of the parameter or column.
The scale of the parameter or column.

MemberSignature.Value: public SqlMetaData (string name, System.Data.SqlDbType sqlDbType, long maxLength, long locale, System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions compareOptions);

Docs.param: To be added.

remarks.para: Only the following are allowed to be passed to the constructor as : Char, NChar, Ntext, NVarChar, Text, VarChar.
Only a specification of , or -1, is allowed for a of Text or NText.
For a of Varchar or Nvarchar, a length specification of , or -1, declares the metadata as varchar(max) and nvarchar(max), respectively.
The following are the default values assigned to , depending on the SqlDbType (the , , , and properties are set to null):

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name, type, maximum length, locale, and compare options.

Docs.param: The name of the parameter or column.
The maximum length of the specified type.
The locale ID of the parameter or column.
The comparison rules of the parameter or column.

MemberSignature.Value: public SqlMetaData (string name, System.Data.SqlDbType sqlDbType, string database, string owningSchema, string objectName);

Docs.param: To be added.

remarks.para: Only the following SqlDbType is allowed to be passed to the constructor as : Xml.
The following are the default values assigned to , depending on the SqlDbType:

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name, type, database name, owning schema, and object name.

Docs.param: The name of the column.
The database name of the XML schema collection of a typed XML instance.
The relational schema name of the XML schema collection of a typed XML instance.
The name of the XML schema collection of a typed XML instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public SqlMetaData (string name, System.Data.SqlDbType sqlDbType, long maxLength, byte precision, byte scale, long localeId, System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions compareOptions, Type userDefinedType);

To be added.

remarks.para: Only the following are allowed to be passed to the constructor as : BigInt, Bit, BitInt, DateTime, Decimal, Float, Image, Int, Money, Ntext, Numeric, Real, SmallDateTime, SmallInt, SmallMoney, Text, TimeStamp, TinyInt, UniqueIdentifier, Variant, Xml.
The following are the default values assigned to , depending on the SqlDbType (the , , , and properties are set to null):

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified column name, type, maximum length, precision, scale, locale ID, compare options, and user-defined type (UDT).

Docs.param: The name of the column.
The maximum length of the specified type.
The precision of the parameter or column.
The scale of the parameter or column.
The comparison rules of the parameter or column.
A instance that points to the UDT.

summary.para: Gets the comparison rules used for the column or parameter.

remarks.para: The default type is .String.

summary.para: Gets the data type of the column or parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData InferFromValue (object value, string name);

summary.para: Infers the metadata from the specified object and returns it as a instance.

returns.para: The inferred metadata as a instance.

Docs.param: The object used from which the metadata is inferred.
The name assigned to the returned instance.

remarks.para: The default value is the current locale of the current thread for string-valued SqlDbTypes, and 0 for SqlDbTypes that do not support collation.
Returns 0 if the collation of the underlying column type is not defined.

summary.para: Gets the locale ID of the column or parameter.

remarks.para: The default value is -1.

summary.para: Gets the length of text, ntext, and image data types.

remarks.para: The potential maximum length for values of the specified column. Returns 0 for types other than fixed and varying length character and binary types. For variable size columns or parameters declared with the constructor parameter, it returns -1.
For .Row this returns the number of columns in the row metadata instance.
The default value is 0.

summary.para: Gets the maximum length of the column or parameter.
Gets the name of the column or parameter.

remarks.para: Returns 0 if the precision of the underlying column type is not defined.

summary.para: Gets the precision of the column or parameter.

remarks.para: Returns 0 if the scale of the underlying column type is not defined.

summary.para: Gets the scale of the column or parameter.

remarks.para: The default value is NVarChar.

summary.para: Gets the data type of the column or parameter.

remarks.para: The default value is null.

summary.para: Gets the three-part name of the user-defined type (UDT) or the SQL Server type represented by the instance.

remarks.para: The default value is null.
This property may be null if the collection is defined within the current database. It is also null if there is no schema collection, in which case and are also null.

summary.para: Gets the name of the database where the schema collection for this XML instance is located.

remarks.para: The default value is null.
This value is null if there is no associated schema collection. If the value is null, then and are also null.

summary.para: Gets the name of the schema collection for this XML instance.

remarks.para: The default value is null.
This value may be null if the collection is defined within the current database and default schema. It is also null if there is no schema collection, in which case and are also null.

summary.para: Gets the owning relational schema where the schema collection for this XML instance is located.
